alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Morgan; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 11:25PM EDT until April 01 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT FOR CENTRAL SHELBY...SOUTHEASTERN MORGAN AND JOHNSON COUNTIES... At 1124 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles east of Martinsville, or 23 miles northeast of Bloomington, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Bargersville and Trafalgar around 1130 PM EDT. Franklin, New Whiteland and Whiteland around 1135 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Boggstown, Marietta, Shelbyville and Fairland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 84 and 97. Interstate 74 between mile markers 105 and 118. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
